alert.note: Alert for Pine (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 15 at 12:01PM CDT until April 17 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Minnesota... Snake River near Pine City affecting Pine County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota...Wisconsin... Mississippi River at Fort Ripley affecting Crow Wing and Morrison Counties. Mississippi River at Aitkin affecting Crow Wing and Aitkin Counties. St. Croix River at Danbury affecting Burnett and Pine Counties. .Heavy rain on top of the existing snowpack will increase the rate of snowmelt. The resultant runoff will cause water levels in area rivers to increase and flooding is expected. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...St. Croix River at Danbury. * WHEN...Until Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Water begins to spread into picnic grounds near the gage near Highway 35. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 7.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon to a crest of 7.0 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Monday morning. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 7.1 feet on 07/02/1958. - Flood safety information can be found at www.weather.gov/safety/flood . && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sun Mon Tue St. Croix River Danbury 7.0 7.0 Sat 10 am CD 7.0 6.8 6.1 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/duluth. The next statement will be issued late tonight by 1200 AM CDT.
